place.name: LLANGWM
place.gazetteerText: LLANGWM, or LANGWM, a parish in Haverfordwest district, Pembroke; on Milford haven, 4 miles ESE of Johnston r. station, and.5 SE by S of Haverfordwest. It has a ferry on the haven, and a post office, of the name of Langwm, under Haverfordwest. Acres, 2,434; of which 410 are water. Real property, £3,020; of which £913 are in mines. Pop., 900. Houses, 188. The property is divided among a few. There is a good oyster fishery. The living is a rectory in the diocese of St. David's. Value, £100. * Patron, alternately Mrs. O. Barlow and Sir J. Owen, Bart. The church is early English, in good condition; and contains monuments of the Roches. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
